Submodules#

blacklight.genetic.chromosomes.convolutional_chromosome module#

class ConvolutionalChromosome(input_shape=None, max_conv_layers=10, max_dense_layers=5, min_conv_layers=1, min_dense_layers=1, genes=None, mutation_prob=None, model_params=None)[source]#

Bases: Chromosome, ABC

Convolutional chromosome class, which represents a convolutional neural network architecture.

The class inherits from BaseChromosome and implements methods to generate random genes, mutate the chromosome, and create a Keras model based on the genes. The genes represent both the convolutional and dense layers of the neural network.

Parameters:

  • input_shape (tuple) – The input shape of the model (width, height, channels).

  • max_conv_layers (int) – The maximum number of convolutional layers in the model.

  • max_dense_layers (int) – The maximum number of dense layers in the model.

  • genes (list) – List of genes from parents (default: None).

  • mutation_prob (float) – Probability of mutation (default: None).

  • model_params (dict) – Dictionary of model parameters such as optimizer, loss, metrics, and learning rate.

model#

The Keras model represented by the chromosome.

Type:

tf.keras.Model

genes#

The list of genes that describe the architecture of the neural network.

Type:

list

length#

The number of genes in the chromosome.

Type:

int

Raises:

ValueError – If the input_shape is not a tuple or if the mutation probability is not between 0 and 1.

_random_genes()#

Generate random genes for the chromosome.

_make_model()#

Create a Keras model based on the chromosome’s genes.

_mutate()[source]#

Mutate the chromosome’s genes.

get_model()[source]#

Return the Keras model.

Examples

>>> input_shape = (32, 32, 3)
>>> max_conv_layers = 5
>>> max_dense_layers = 3
>>> model_params = {
    "optimizer": tf.keras.optimizers.Adam,
    "loss": 'categorical_crossentropy',
    "metrics": ['accuracy'],
    "learning_rate": 0.001
}
>>> chromosome = ConvolutionalChromosome(input_shape, max_conv_layers, max_dense_layers, model_params=model_params)
>>> model = chromosome.get_model()
_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>#
_mutate() → None[source]#

Mutate the chromosome’s genes while preserving the structure.

This method applies random mutations to the genes of the chromosome while ensuring that convolutional layers remain in the convolutional section and dense layers remain in the dense section. It selects a random layer for mutation and changes its parameters based on the layer type.

Raises:

ValueError – If an unexpected layer type is encountered in the genes.

static cross_over(chromosome_a: ConvolutionalChromosome, chromosome_b: ConvolutionalChromosome) → ConvolutionalChromosome[source]#

Perform a crossover operation between two ConvolutionalChromosome instances.

This function creates two new offspring by crossing over the genes of the input chromosomes. The crossover operation is applied separately to the convolutional part and the dense part of the chromosomes, respecting their structure.

Parameters:

  • chromosome_a (ConvolutionalChromosome) – The first parent chromosome.

  • chromosome_b (ConvolutionalChromosome) – The second parent chromosome.

Returns:

A new ConvolutionalChromosome instances created through crossover.

Return type:

ConvolutionalChromosome

Raises:

ValueError – If the “flatten” layer is not found in the genes or if the input chromosomes have different input shapes.

get_model() → Model[source]#
static split_convolutional_dense(genes: list) → tuple[list, list][source]#

Split convolutional and dense layers from the genes.

Parameters:

genes – list of alleles for a convolutional chromosome

Returns:

the convolutional part of the genes - dense_part: the dense part of the genes

Return type:

  • conv_part

blacklight.genetic.chromosomes.feed_forward_chromosome module#

class FeedForwardChromosome(model_params: ModelConfig, genes: List[Tuple[int, str]] | None = None, mutation_prob: float | None = None)[source]#

Bases: Chromosome

Feed forward chromosome class representing a feed forward neural network.

Parameters:

  • ModelConfig (model_params) – The parameters for the Keras model. Defaults to None.

  • genes (Optional[List[Tuple[int, str]]], optional) – The list of genes representing the neural network structure. Defaults to None.

  • mutation_prob (Optional[int], optional) – The probability of mutation for the chromosome. Defaults to None.

Examples

>>> chromosome = FeedForwardChromosome(input_shape=10)
_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>#
_mutate() → None[source]#

Mutate the chromosome by randomly changing one of its genes.

_random_genes() → List[Tuple[str, int, str]][source]#

Generate random feed forward genes for the chromosome.

Returns:

A list of genes representing the neural network structure.

Return type:

List[Tuple[int, str]]

static cross_over(chromosome_a: FeedForwardChromosome, chromosome_b: FeedForwardChromosome) → FeedForwardChromosome[source]#

Handle feed forward cross over between two chromosomes.

Parameters:

  • chromosome_a (FeedForwardChromosome) – The first chromosome to perform cross over.

  • chromosome_b (FeedForwardChromosome) – The second chromosome to perform cross over.

Returns:

A new chromosome created by cross over between the input chromosomes.

Return type:

FeedForwardChromosome

Examples

>>> chromosome_a = FeedForwardChromosome(input_shape=10)
>>> chromosome_b = FeedForwardChromosome(input_shape=10)
>>> new_chromosome = FeedForwardChromosome.cross_over(chromosome_a,chromosome_b)
evaluate_model(train_data, test_data)[source]#

Evaluate the model and return the loss and accuracy.

Returns:

The loss and accuracy of the model.

Return type:

Tuple[float, float]

get_model() → Sequential[source]#

Get the Keras Sequential model of the chromosome.

Returns:

The feed forward neural network model.

Return type:

tf.keras.Sequential

Examples

>>> chromosome = FeedForwardChromosome(input_shape=10)
>>> model = chromosome.get_model()
